value.title: Secure your Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: Secure your Azure SQL Database to keep your data secure and diagnose potential security concerns as they happen.

images.title: Secure your Azure SQL Database

value.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API
value.excerpt: Create an application that that uses an Azure Cosmos DB as a graph database. Store, retrieve and manipulate graph data and visualize it using Data Explorer.

images.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API

value.title: Synthesize Text Input to Speech
value.excerpt: Learn how to synthesize text to speech using the Speech-to-Text service.

images.title: Synthesize Text Input to Speech

value.title: Introduction to threat modeling
value.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective way to help secure your systems, applications, networks, and services. It's an engineering technique that identifies potential threats and recommendations to help reduce risk and meet security objectives earlier in the development lifecycle.

images.title: Introduction to threat modeling
Introduction to threat modeling

value.title: Train a machine learning model with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Machine Learning to train a model and register it in a workspace.

images.title: Train a machine learning model with Azure Machine Learning

value.title: Transcribe speech input to text
value.excerpt: Speech-to-text from the speech service,  known as speech recognition, enables real time transcription of audio streams into text. Your applications, tools, or devices can consume, display, and take action on this text as command input.

images.title: Transcribe speech input to text

value.title: Azure Data Fundamentals: Explore non-relational data in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn the fundamentals of database concepts in a cloud environment, get basic skilling in cloud data services, and build your foundational knowledge of cloud data services within Microsoft Azure. You will explore non-relational data offerings, provisioning and deploying non-relational databases, and non-relational data stores with Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Explore non-relational data offerings in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure Table Storage, Azure Blob Storage, Azure File Storage, and Azure Cosmos DB, and explore situations for using them.

images.title: Explore non-relational data offerings in Azure

topItems.title: Explore provisioning and deploying non-relational data services in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to provision and configure Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Lake , Azure Blob Storage, and Azure File Storage.

images.title: Explore provisioning and deploying non-relational data services in Azure

topItems.title: Manage non-relational data stores in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to upload and retrieve data held in Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Blob storage, and Azure File storage.

images.title: Manage non-relational data stores in Azure
Explore non-relational data offerings in Azure

value.title: Capture feedback and monitoring data to continuously improve your software learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure release pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications.

topItems.title: Recommend and design system feedback mechanisms
topItems.excerpt: Learn how surveys and application analytics create a feedback loop that helps you understand the voice of the customer.

images.title: Recommend and design system feedback mechanisms

topItems.title: Route system feedback to development teams
topItems.excerpt: Learn how continuous monitoring and dashboards give you insight into how customers use your software and where patterns of failure occur.

images.title: Route system feedback to development teams

topItems.title: Manage site reliability
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage site reliability.

images.title: Manage site reliability

value.title: Introduction to machine learning with Python and Azure Notebooks
value.excerpt: Python has become a dominant language for doing data analysis with machine learning. Learn how to leverage Python and associated libraries in Jupyter Notebooks run on Azure Notebooks to predict patterns and identify trends.

topItems.title: Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks
topItems.excerpt: Create an Azure Notebook and use three popular Python libraries to analyze climate data collected by NASA, then share it.

images.title: Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks

topItems.title: Predict flight delays by creating a machine learning model in Python
topItems.excerpt: Import airline arrival data into a Jupyter notebook and use Pandas to clean it. Then, build a machine learning model with Scikit-Learn and use Matplotlib to visualize output.

images.title: Predict flight delays by creating a machine learning model in Python

topItems.title: Analyze the sentiment of reviews with Keras
topItems.excerpt: Keras is a high-level neural networks API, written in Python, that runs on top of other deep learning tools such as TensorFlow. This module uses Keras to build a neural network that scores text, such as user reviews for sentiment.

images.title: Analyze the sentiment of reviews with Keras
Analyze climate data with Azure Notebooks

value.title: Manage cloud resources
value.excerpt:
Learn more about how the cloud works by exploring it's underlying technology of virtualization, how to take advantage of the cloud for scale, and how to automate cloud resource management.
In this learning path, you will:

Learn about virtualization and how it's used in the cloud
Know what VMs and containers are
Understand what scale, load, and common load patterns are
Know what autoscaling is and be familiar with autoscaling techniques
Learn how to automate cloud resource management with scripts
Understand the concept of infrastructure-as-code

In Partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity
topItems.excerpt: Discover what cloud elasticity means and different ways to scale your cloud resources.

images.title: Scale your cloud resources with elasticity

topItems.title: Automate cloud resource management
topItems.excerpt: Learn about how to automate cloud resource management with scripts and infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.

images.title: Automate cloud resource management

value.title: Plan and implement data platform resources
value.excerpt: Deploy data platform resources in Azure for SQL Server and Open Source databases. Explore options for upgrade and migration.  Calculate resource requirements and create templates.

topItems.title: Deploy SQL Server in a virtual machine
topItems.excerpt: Configure virtual machine sizing, storage, and networking options to ensure adequate performance for your database workloads. Choose and configure appropriate high availability options. Investigate options for migrating existing workloads.

topItems.title: Deploy Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Provision and deploy Azure SQL Database and SQL Server Managed Instances. Select the appropriate options when performing a migration to the SQL PaaS platform.

topItems.title: Deploy MariaDB, MySQL, and PostgreSQL on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Compare Open Source Azure Database offerings with Azure SQL Server offerings. Configure an Open Source database and configure high availability and security options.

value.title: Automate DevOps processes by using GitHub Apps
value.excerpt: Get started with GitHub in about an hour.

value.excerpt: Discover the services and tools available to automate the deployment and configuration of your Azure infrastructure.

images.title: Choose a compute provisioning solution for your application

value.excerpt: Create, train and test a custom image classification model using the Custom Vision Service to accurately identify paintings from famous artists.

images.title: Classify images with the Microsoft Custom Vision Service

value.excerpt: Discover what cloud elasticity means and different ways to scale your cloud resources.

value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

value.title: Create an Azure Database for PostgreSQL server
value.excerpt: Azure Database for PostgreSQL provides fully managed, enterprise-ready community PostgreSQL database as a service. Learn how to create and deploy this service and connect it to your applications.

images.title: Create an Azure Database for PostgreSQL server

value.title: Create a multistage pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Design and create a realistic release pipeline that promotes changes to various testing and staging environments.

images.title: Create a multistage pipeline by using Azure Pipelines

value.title: Orchestrating machine learning with pipelines
value.excerpt: Orchestrating machine learning training with pipelines is a key element of DevOps for machine learning. In this module, you'll learn how to create, publish, and run pipelines to train models in Azure Machine Learning.

value.title: Deploy Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: Provision and deploy Azure SQL Database and SQL Server Managed Instances. Select the appropriate options when performing a migration to the SQL PaaS platform.

value.title: Deploy batch inference pipelines with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Machine learning models are often used to generate predictions from large numbers of observations in a batch process. To accomplish this, you can use Azure Machine Learning to publish a batch inference pipeline.

images.title: Deploy batch inference pipelines with Azure Machine Learning

value.title: Deploy SQL Server in a virtual machine
value.excerpt: Configure virtual machine sizing, storage, and networking options to ensure adequate performance for your database workloads. Choose and configure appropriate high availability options. Investigate options for migrating existing workloads.

value.excerpt: Build an application that spans multiple geographic locations for high availability and resiliency.

value.title: Introduction to implementing lambda architecture for IoT solutions
value.excerpt: An overview of the concepts and resources behind storage technologies used in IoT applications on Azure. After completing the module, you can determine when to use Blob storage, Data Lake storage, CosmosBD, and Time Series Insights.
